# Web Chattify
![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/Powered%20by-Coffee-brightgreen?logo=coffeescript)
![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/Open-Source-brightgreen?logo=github)

![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/Made%20with-Symfony-brightgreen?logo=symfony)
![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/Debugger-XDebug-brightgreen?logo=data:image/png;base64,)

![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/Made%20with-React-brightgreen?logo=react)
![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/MUI-Style-brightgreen?logo=mui)
![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-Router-brightgreen?logo=data:image/png;base64,)

This project has been developed as TFG (Final Degree Project) to [I.E.S. HLanz](https://www.ieshlanz.es/), this project
has as objective develop a chat web app, allowing users to create chatrooms, invite friends and of course send and messages
in real time.

This project has been built to be easy to deploy using several technologies and development techniques like:

 - Docker
 - Symfony
   - XDebug integration
   - Test Driven Development (TDD) using Behat
   - DB base fixtures using AliceBundle
 - React 
   - Style using [Material (MUI)](https://mui.com/)
   - Dynamic routing using React Router

Feel free to fork this repository to learn, modify and make your own chat app. Please give me the proper credit linking to this repository, Thanks!

## Features

All app features are supported by test in Behat, that also works as documentation, to qet more specific info check folder [/features](/features).

As summary this application allow:

- User login / sign up
- Create chatrooms
- Invite other registered users to chatrooms
- User can send messages in a chatroom
- User can edit their own messages
- Admin Users can see the history of edited messages

## Getting Started
This project works with docker so before start ensure that it's installed [Docker Composer](https://docs.docker.com/compose/install/).

The project have a ``Makefile`` with so many utilities useful to start the project and help on the development.

- Run ``make up`` first time can take some time to build.
- Run ``make init`` this command initialize symfony and react (Only need run first time)
- Go to [http://localhost:8000](http://localhost:8000) and test the application

To stop just run ``make down``.

See [Makefile doc](/doc/Makefile.md) to more useful info.
